Pre-Game Insights: The Yankees have a 1-8 record against the Red Sox in 2023.
The Red Sox have dominated the Yankees offensively, outscoring them by 28 runs.
The Yankees' pitching ranks third in the league with a.233 batting average against (BAA) and a 3.99 ERA, but their offense averages just 4.2 runs per game.
The Red Sox have a.264 batting average,.329 on-base percentage,.437 slugging percentage, and a.766 OPS, while their pitching has a 4.62 ERA and a.260 opposing batting average.
Fenway Park has historically been challenging for the Yankees, with a.230 batting average,.302 on-base percentage, and a.391 slugging percentage.
The Yankees' recent form shows a 6-4 record in their last 10 games, compared to the Red Sox's 4-6 record.
The Yankees need to avoid another losing skid as they approach the end of the season.
Injuries have impacted both teams, with key players like Luis Severino and Jasson Dominguez for the Yankees, and Jarren Duran and James Paxton for the Red Sox, sidelined.
